ui.gameTitle: SIU 2D - Simulator of the Incredible Universe

warnings.title: Important Warnings
warnings.warning1: Warning 1 - Please do not exaggerate the number of Celestial Bodies (Planets, Stars, etc.). If you add too many, the game may lag depending on your device. We want you to have a good experience: simple, without excess, with good gameplay and learning.
warnings.warning2: Warning 2 - The game is in development. Bugs may occur. Please report them so we can fix and improve your gaming experience.
warnings.warning3: Warning 3 - This game is not 100% realistic. Sizes, distances and other factors are simplified to facilitate gameplay and understanding of the simulated universe.
warnings.warning4: Warning 4 - Please do not abuse the game, as this may cause performance issues and crashes. The game is designed for casual and fun play, especially regarding Warning 1 above.
warnings.enjoy: Enjoy the Game! We hope you have fun exploring the universe and creating your own celestial bodies. If you have questions or suggestions, feel free to contact us.

radiation.name: Radiation
radiation.description: Energetic particles emitted by black holes and quasars. Much smaller than space dust.

nebula.name: Nebula
nebula.description: Clouds of gas and dust that form stars and planets.

spaceDust.name: Space Dust
spaceDust.description: Microscopic particles that form the basis of celestial bodies.

meteoroid.name: Meteoroid
meteoroid.description: Rock or metal fragments in space.

comet.name: Comet
comet.description: Icy bodies with tails that form near stars.

asteroid.name: Asteroid
asteroid.description: Small rocky bodies with irregular shapes.

planetoid.name: Planetoid
planetoid.description: Celestial bodies smaller than planets but larger than asteroids.

rockyPlanet.name: Rocky Planet
rockyPlanet.description: Rocky planets with continents, atmosphere and oceans.

gasGiant.name: Gas Giant
gasGiant.description: Gas giants with atmospheric bands and storms.

brownDwarf.name: Brown Dwarf
brownDwarf.description: Failed stars that didn't reach sufficient mass.

redDwarf.name: Red Dwarf
redDwarf.description: Nearly failed star, but somewhat eternal and hot.

ttauriStar.name: T Tauri Star
ttauriStar.description: Young star in contraction phase, highly active.

redGiant.name: Red Giant
redGiant.description: Penultimate phase of a common star.

carbonStar.name: Carbon Star
carbonStar.description: Cool star with high carbon concentration.

redSupergiant.name: Red Supergiant
redSupergiant.description: Penultimate phase of a giant star.

hypergiant.name: Hypergiant
hypergiant.description: Extremely luminous and massive giant star.

massiveStar.name: Massive Star
massiveStar.description: Star with mass over 8 times that of the Sun.

supermassiveStar.name: Supermassive Star
supermassiveStar.description: Star with mass over 8 times that of the Sun.

whiteDwarf.name: White Dwarf
whiteDwarf.description: Remnant of low-mass stars after the red giant phase.

HeliumWhiteDwarf.name: Helium White Dwarf
HeliumWhiteDwarf.description: Remnant of stars with high helium content.

blackDwarf.name: Black Dwarf
blackDwarf.description: Final stage of a white dwarf, completely cold and dark.

pulsar.name: Pulsar
pulsar.description: A type of neutron star with cosmic radiation beams - a cosmic lighthouse!

quarkStar.name: Quark Star
quarkStar.description: Neutron stars with condensed strange cores.

strangeStar.name: Strange Star
strangeStar.description: Hypothetical star made of quark matter.

blackHole.name: Black Hole
blackHole.description: Regions of space with extreme gravity. Stellar/Intermediate

quasar.name: Quasar
quasar.description: Active supermassive black holes with energy jets.

wormhole.name: Wormhole
wormhole.description: Hypothetical space-time tunnel connecting two points.
